root.name: getContent()

example.code: # The following short XML file called "positions.xml" is parsed # in the code below. It must be in the project's "data" folder. # # &lt?xml version=&quot1.0&quot?&gt # &ltpositions&gt # &ltposition id="0"&gt128.111&lt/position&gt # &ltposition id="1"&gt256.222&lt/position&gt # &ltposition id="2"&gt512.333&lt/position&gt # &lt/positions&gt XML xml def setup(): xml = loadXML("positions.xml") XML firstChild = xml.getChild("position") println(firstChild.getFloatContent()) # Sketch prints: # 128.111

root.description: Returns the content of an element as a float. If there is no such content, either null or the provided default value is returned.
